newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Valora expects 1996 to rise 70 pct.
newsitem.headline: Valora expects 1996 to rise 70 pct.

text.p: Swiss retail, catering and bedding group Valora Holding AG, formerly Merkur, said it expected net profit for 1996 to rise to about 70 million Swiss francs from 41.2 million last year.
It said the improvement was based on more intensive marketing, strict cost controls and acquisitions.
"Experience shows that the second half of the year generally contributes about two-thirds of the annual net profit," Valora said.
It earlier said net profit for the first half rose 29 percent to 26.1 million Swiss francs, excluding minority interests.
Valora prodicted sales for the full year would total 2.9 billion Swiss francs, up from 2.87 billion last year.
